title: China targets permanently shadowed regions at lunar south pole
summary: China is looking to land spacecraft near permanently shadowed regions near the south pole of the moon to investigate the potential presence of resources trapped in craters.

title: SpaceX rolls out first new Starship prototype in nine months
summary: For the first time in more than nine months, SpaceX has rolled a new Starship prototype to its Starbase, Texas launch facilities...

title: Rocket Report: Meet the Gravity-1 rocket; will Starship really cut launch costs?
summary: "I probably can’t express in words what it meant for me."

title: NASA to Pick Next Generation Spacesuits for Moonwalking, Spacewalking
summary: NASA will announce at 2 p.m. EDT (1 p.m. CDT) Wednesday, June 1, the company, or companies, selected to move forward in developing the next generation of spacesuits for Artemis missions at the Moon and the International Space Station during an event at the agency’s Johnson Space Center in Houston.

title: General Dynamics wins ground systems contract for Space Development Agency’s megaconstellation
summary: General Dynamics Mission Systems won a $324.5 million contract to operate the ground systems and manage network operations of the Space Development Agency’s low Earth orbit constellation.

title: Space Force rolls out cybersecurity standards for commercial providers of satellite services
summary: The Space Systems Command announced May 26 the official rollout of a new process to assess the cybersecurity of commercial satellite operators that do business with the Defense Department.

title: NASA Supports Small Business Research to Power Future Exploration
summary: NASA has selected hundreds of small businesses and dozens of research institutions to develop technology to help drive the future of space exploration, ranging from novel sensors and electronics to new types of software and cutting-edge materials.

title: No SpaceX Falcon Heavy payload is safe as NASA Psyche mission announces delay
summary: SpaceX’s first dedicated Falcon Heavy launch for NASA has been hit by a seven-week delay after spacecraft engineers discovered a software anomaly...

title: Additive manufacturing has progressed far beyond brackets
summary: Spacecraft developers are additively manufacturing engine nozzles and other complex spacecraft components.

title: Economy could dampen growth of space industry
summary: Broader economic issues as well as the performance of some space companies could slow the growth of the industry in the next few years, executives warn.
